means: 歪曲( distort的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Her actions and thoughts became distorted. So did her behavior.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的行动和思想变得扭曲了，她的态度也是。

sentence.Network_en: His size was persistently distorted by the cartoonists.
sentence.Network_cn: 漫画家们总是把他画得变形了。

sentence.Network_en: Her distorted face was ablaze with rage.
sentence.Network_cn: 在狂怒之下,她那张扭曲的脸涨得通红.

entry.def: If you distort a statement, fact, or idea, you report or represent it in an untrue way.

example.ex: The media distorts reality; categorises people as all good or all bad...
example.tran: 媒体会歪曲事实，将人说得不是完美无缺就是一无是处。

example.ex: The minister has said his remarks at the weekend have been distorted.
example.tran: 部长说他周末的讲话被曲解了。

entry.def: If something you can see or hear is distorted or distorts, its appearance or sound is changed so that it seems unclear.

example.ex: A painter may exaggerate or distort shapes and forms...
example.tran: 画家可能会对线条和形状进行夸大或扭曲。

example.ex: His size was persistently distorted by the cartoonists...
example.tran: 漫画家们总是把他画得变形了。

means.word_mean: 1. strained or wrenched out of normal shape;
2. so badly formed or out of shape as to be ugly;

sentences.sentence: "a limp caused by a malformed foot"

means.word_mean: 3. having an intended meaning altered or misrepresented;

sentences.sentence: "many of the facts seemed twisted out of any semblance to reality"
